questions.question: What is the empirical formula of FTR-P1?
questions.answer: C24H12D8N2O8Zn2

questions.question: At what temperature was the crystal structure of FTR-P1d collected?
questions.answer: The crystal structure of FTR-P1d was collected at 110 K, 160 K, and 275 K.

questions.question: What is the space group of FTR-P1d at 275 K?
questions.answer: The space group of FTR-P1d at 275 K is Cmma.

questions.question: What type of adsorption isotherm does FTR-P1 display for CO2 at 195 K?
questions.answer: FTR-P1 displays a type I CO2 adsorption isotherm at 195 K.

questions.question: What is the maximum CO2 uptake for FTR-P1d at 195 K?
questions.answer: The maximum CO2 uptake for FTR-P1d at 195 K is 1.73 mmol/g STP.

questions.question: What is the activation energy for the 4-site flip reorientation of ring A in the β-phase of FTR-P1d?
questions.answer: The activation energy for the 4-site flip reorientation of ring A in the β-phase of FTR-P1d is 1.2 kcal/mol.

questions.question: What is the phase transition temperature range observed for FTR-P1d under vacuum?
questions.answer: The phase transition temperature range observed for FTR-P1d under vacuum is from 210 K to 390 K.

questions.question: Is the molecular motion of FTR-P1d reversible upon heating and cooling?
questions.answer: Yes, the molecular motion of FTR-P1d is reversible upon heating and cooling.

questions.question: Does the presence of CO2 affect the rotational dynamics of bipyridine rings in FTR-P1d?
questions.answer: Yes, the presence of CO2 affects the rotational dynamics of bipyridine rings in FTR-P1d.

questions.question: What method was used to calculate the isosteric heat of adsorption for FTR-P1?
questions.answer: The isosteric heat of adsorption for FTR-P1 was calculated using Langmuir and Langmuir-Freundlich models, and measured with sorption-coupled microcalorimetry.

questions.question: What is the effect of CO2 loading on the phase transition of FTR-P1d?
questions.answer: CO2 loading leads to a phase transition from the β-phase to the α'-phase in FTR-P1d.

questions.question: What is the average isosteric heat of adsorption for FTR-P1 according to the Langmuir model?
questions.answer: The average isosteric heat of adsorption for FTR-P1 according to the Langmuir model is 32.5 kJ/mol.

questions.question: Can the dynamics of molecular rotors in FTR-P1d be actively manipulated by external stimuli?
questions.answer: Yes, the dynamics of molecular rotors in FTR-P1d can be actively manipulated by external stimuli such as CO2.

questions.question: What computational method was used for potential energy scans of the BCP conformations in FTR-P1?
questions.answer: DFT (Density Functional Theory) and Molecular Mechanics (MM) computational methods were used for potential energy scans of the BCP conformations in FTR-P1.

questions.question: What is the role of the paddle-wheel node in the structure of FTR-P1?
questions.answer: The paddle-wheel node acts as a structural anchor, coordinating with the carboxylate groups of BCP and the nitrogen atoms of bipyridine to form the 3D framework of FTR-P1.

questions.question: Does FTR-P1 exhibit reversible gas-capture properties?
questions.answer: Yes, FTR-P1 exhibits reversible gas-capture properties.

questions.question: What is the significance of the disorder observed in the bipyridine and BCP ligands in FTR-P1?
questions.answer: The disorder observed in the bipyridine and BCP ligands in FTR-P1 indicates flexibility in the structure, which is crucial for the dynamic behavior and gas adsorption properties of the material.

questions.question: What is the impact of DMF on the dynamics of FTR-P1d?
questions.answer: The presence of DMF in FTR-P1d impacts the dynamics by altering the rotational frequencies of the bipyridine rings, indicating that guest molecules can modulate the motion of molecular rotors.

questions.question: Is the rotational motion of the BCP rotors in FTR-P1d temperature-dependent?
questions.answer: Yes, the rotational motion of the BCP rotors in FTR-P1d is temperature-dependent.

questions.question: What experimental technique was used to investigate the spin-lattice relaxation times (T1) of FTR-P1d?
questions.answer: 1H NMR spectroscopy was used to investigate the spin-lattice relaxation times (T1) of FTR-P1d.
